movie_name: To All the Boys I've Loved Before

reviews.text: One must mention the performance by Condor. Her comedic timing is perfect, but more than that, she really embodies this character...
reviews.author: Aaron Charles

reviews.text: Every movie should have a Lara Jean Covey and Peter Kavinsky — except I don’t know that we, as a society, are prepared for that much cuteness.
reviews.author: Patricia Karounos

reviews.text: It has a strong, flawed protagonist who reminds us of some important life lessons as she is learning them at the same time.
reviews.author: Nicholas Oon

reviews.text: Thanks to films like To All The Boys I've Loved Before, The Edge of Seventeen, and Running from Grace, Asian American teenagers can see dimensional versions of themselves onscreen who are worthy of falling in love, no matter who they end up with.
reviews.author: Laura Sirikul

reviews.text: The romance I see is too sweet for my taste. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Yasser Medina

reviews.text: Lara Jean learns a lot of lessons--she changes and she grows--but she never becomes anything other than herself. It's always her discovering new sides of herself. That's so important for young women to see.
reviews.author: Sherin Nicole

reviews.text: To All the Boys I've Loved Before is heartwarmingly sweet and features delightful performances.
reviews.author: Katie Smith-Wong

reviews.text: The resultant plot follows a style reminiscent of the Shakespeare-inspired Ten Things I Hate About You and She's All That, making To All The Boys I've Loved an enjoyable trip down the comedy-of-deception genre.
reviews.author: Redmond Bacon

reviews.text: Thrills in part because most viewers are all too familiar with what it feels like to baldly deny feelings for another person even as they become patently obvious to everyone else.
reviews.author: Hannah Giorgis

reviews.text: This sweetness works because, like Johnson et al., we in the audience know what shape rom-coms have historically taken, and are thus ready and able to have our expectations subverted in the purest of ways.
reviews.author: Alexis Gunderson

reviews.text: Don't sleep on this movie just because it's familiar-save for a lead character and actor blazing a trail for diversity-To All The Boys I've Loved Before is a crush-worthy movie that will have your heart swooning.
reviews.author: Karl Delossantos

reviews.text: A well-intentioned, good-natured teen romance that plays it safe and ends up being blander than it should have been.
reviews.author: Sameen Amer

reviews.text: 'To All the Boys I've Loved Before' is a solvent romantic comedy that knows how to handle a hackneyed idea to make your viewing enjoyable. [Full Review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Mikel Zorrilla

reviews.text: Lana Condor is super charming as the lead character Lara Jean in this perfectly pleasant teen romance.
reviews.author: Rachel Wagner

reviews.text: This is the kind of smart movie for and about contemporary teenage life that has been in short supply in recent years.
reviews.author: Peter Sobczynski

reviews.text: Y'all, it was precious.
reviews.author: Amanda Greever

reviews.text: A teen rom-com success for Netflix.
reviews.author: Fiona Underhill

reviews.text: Not a moment will cause you emotional turmoil, except maybe some swooning.
reviews.author: Bridget Read

reviews.text: Takes everything audiences love about the genre and wraps it in a Hughes-esque bow to offer viewers a carefree, easily rewatchable film sure to entertain movie lovers of all ages.
reviews.author: Matt Ward

reviews.text: A perfect blend of John Hughes teen angst with Disney film teen cheesiness, To All the Boys contains familiar coming-of-age tropes mixed with fresh narrative ideas.
reviews.author: Joel Mayward

reviews.text: With great lead performances, some good comedy and heart (and far from falling into cliché) this is a charming and happily sweet movie.
reviews.author: Matt Hudson

reviews.text: For those who say To All the Boys is trodden territory, I ask: Trodden territory for who?
reviews.author: Li Lai

reviews.text: Some of the actors and actresses pop off the screen and none more than Centineo. He is a star from the word go.
reviews.author: Alan French

reviews.text: This movie is witty, funny, heartwarming and will make even the nonbelievers of true love, or at least romance, into converts.
reviews.author: Kiera Allen

reviews.text: It is such a cute movie. It's so adorable, so funny, so sweet. It's corny, but not overwhelmingly corny. It so works.
reviews.author: Funmi Sunmonu

reviews.text: If you want a realistic portrayal of the ugly truth of high school relationships, this ain't it. If you're after escapism, this might just be the best fantasy film since Lord of the Rings.
reviews.author: Amelia Navascues

reviews.text: It's not just that it looks nice; it has a palette, a color scheme...beyond all that, it's just a great, fun, interesting situation these characters find themselves in.
reviews.author: Eli Glasner

reviews.text: To All The Boys I've Loved Before presents an adolescent romance that appears extremely generic on the surface, but stashes away enough novel elements to feel fresh. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Emmanuel Báez

reviews.text: The pleasure of the film does not come from being surprised, it comes from experiencing these characters. Perhaps because the source material is a novel, the people in the story blossom beyond their boilerplate romantic comedy slots.
reviews.author: Asia Frey

reviews.text: Much of the movie's success is down to Condor's gentle appeal and her quiet chemistry with co-star Noah Centineo .
reviews.author: Brad Newsome

reviews.text: No prizes for guessing who she ends up falling in love with, but as predictable as it is, the story is told with flair, both narrative and visual.
reviews.author: Alison de Souza

reviews.text: If there was any doubt that Netflix is dominating the romantic comedy genre this year, this should end the argument. It's full of heart, charm and genuine feel goods.
reviews.author: Jeffrey Lyles

reviews.text: Incredibly funny and heartfelt with star making turns from Lana Condor and Noah Centineo, this movie is just a delight from start to finish.
reviews.author: Terence Johnson

reviews.text: Incurable romantics of all ages should enjoy this heartwarming teenage rom-com.
reviews.author: Betty Jo Tucker

reviews.text: Condor is a real find as a promising actor we'll be sure to see more of, too.
reviews.author: Leigh Paatsch

reviews.text: Centineo performs a type of compassionate male energy that is in short supply in movies at the moment, but Lana Condor is undeniably TATBILB's star.
reviews.author: Rachel Syme

reviews.text: It's wonderful cliché that works... The script understands exactly where the effervescence of a great romcom lies.
reviews.author: Anna Leszkiewicz

reviews.text: A rom-com that although it falls in certain clichés, it brings a fresh air to youthful adaptations. [Full Review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Monica Urruchua

reviews.text: The energetic, game cast and smart writing that makes To All the Boys I've Loved Before one of the best romantic comedies in years, and the strongest outing in the genre released by Netflix thus far.
reviews.author: Deborah Krieger

reviews.text: To All the Boys is a joy to watch and rises to the top of a cliché genre on the strength of its whip-smart writing and cast.
reviews.author: Frida Garza

reviews.text: It's a stylish pastel-tinted confection of a movie, one that knows every single one of the romantic tropes it's working with backwards and forwards, and loves them with all its pure and wholesome heart.
reviews.author: Constance Grady

reviews.text: This generation is lucky to have To All the Boys I've Ever Loved Before as the teen romance comedy of their generation.
reviews.author: Jordan Calhoun

reviews.text: It's so undeniably sweet.
reviews.author: Wenlei Ma

reviews.text: There's a lot more competition now than there was when we wore out our Can't By Me Love or John Hughes VHSes, but I have faith that To All The Boys I've Loved Before will become heavily quoted by current high schoolers.
reviews.author: Fred Topel

reviews.text: ...doesn't set out to break the mold, but by staying true to its characters and the mixed-up feelings of youth, it improves on what so many films before it have gotten wrong.
reviews.author: Travis Hopson

reviews.text: There is nothing mean-spirited or pernicious in its content. Just a thoroughly sweet, at times hysterically funny narrative that manages a certain amount of endearing authenticity.
reviews.author: Tynan Yanaga

reviews.text: Netflix's best rom-com yet.
reviews.author: Joe Reid

reviews.text: Like any teen story, To All the Boys has some growing pains... Still, we'll forgive it. Sure, it hits at core truths about new love. But it's still a fantasy, just not the bodice-ripping one of Lara Jean's teen daydreams.
reviews.author: Esther Zuckerman

reviews.text: As lighthearted entertainment and a look at a too-little-seen culture, it's a welcome addition to Netflix's blossoming roster of teen romcoms.
reviews.author: Renee Schonfeld

reviews.text: A delightful and refreshing take on the teen drama.
reviews.author: Ferdosa Abdi

reviews.text: Charming and sweet and as such is a much-needed storm in a very long drought that reminds us not just what we've been missing all these years, but also just how timeless teen movies and their coming-of-age stories can be.
reviews.author: Kaitlin Thomas

reviews.text: To All the Boys simmers in nostalgia by paying homage to the great teen comedies of the past. However, the film manages to make its own mark with its charismatic cast and engaging filmmaking style.
reviews.author: Gabrielle Bondi

reviews.text: Centineo is the big beating heart at the center of the somewhat reserved "To All The Boys I've Loved Before." He's a lot like his character, bringing out the best in this love story.
reviews.author: Katie Walsh

reviews.text: Every frame of the movie is stunning and set up so meticulously that it makes you want to Instagram your TV screen.
reviews.author: Peggy Truong

reviews.text: The film is precisely what it should be: pleasing and clever, comforting and fun and romantic.
reviews.author: Linda Holmes

reviews.text: A delightfully adorkable time.
reviews.author: Nell Minow

reviews.text: To All the Boys... is strictly Disney Channel stuff, but it's got more substance then you expect.
reviews.author: Chris Nashawaty

reviews.text: It deserves to find its place alongside warm, whip-smart teen classics that are unafraid of complete and utter romance, like Easy A and The Duff.
reviews.author: Delia Harrington

reviews.text: It's a smart, funny, sweet, winning movie, and I was constantly amazed by how much I enjoyed it.
reviews.author: Matt Goldberg

reviews.text: To All The Boys I've Loved Before is a charming young adult romantic comedy that tells a sweet and joyful story of young love for modern audiences.
reviews.author: Molly Freeman

reviews.text: All this brews to make a perfect first-boyfriend fantasy, the kind you dreamed of as a girl and the kind you may still reminisce over. This makes To All the Boys I've Loved Before a total treat and a perfect pick for a night of Netflix and Girls Night in.
reviews.author: Kristy Puchko

reviews.text: Stilted and scattered and strangely cold in its cinematography, it's a handsomely shot whole lotta nothin'.
reviews.author: Inkoo Kang

reviews.text: Its heartwarming and clear-eyed approach to first love and the challenges of coming-of-age distinguishes it from its contemporaries. Add it to your queue.
reviews.author: Cady Lang

reviews.text: To All the Boys keeps a tight grip on the formula of every rom-com and adapts it for the younger set.
reviews.author: Kate Erbland

reviews.text: A pleasant and perfectly relatable situation comedy about a 16-year-old's awkward first attempts at dating.
reviews.author: Peter Debruge

reviews.text: So, as was said recently about another film, leave your brain at the door and lead with your heart. Sometimes you just need to feel good, no matter what your age. This is a good start.
reviews.author: Neely Swanson

reviews.text: Unlike previous Netflix misses, To All the Boys I've Loved Before is likely to be watched on repeat for years to come by romance fans of all ages.
reviews.author: Kimber Myers

reviews.text: This shows the audience within the first few minutes why it belongs in the upper echelon of "fake relationship" romcoms.
reviews.author: Courtney Howard

reviews.text: I didn't appreciate what a unicorn-like rarity a good, solid boy is in a teen comedy until To All the Boys I've Loved Before.
reviews.author: Emily Yoshida

synopsis: A teenage girl's love letters are exposed and wreak havoc on her life.
